usefulItems: baking tray (20 cm x 30 cm), baking paper, serving bowls, large bowl, oven
title: Curried Carrot And Ginger Soup

ingredients.content: 5 cm fresh root ginger, peeled, cut in round slices (2 mm)
1 - 2 Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored and cut in pieces (2 cm)
400 g tinned chickpeas, rinsed and well drained (weight is pre-draining)
2 pinches ground black pepper, plus extra to garnish

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.
Place onion, garlic and ginger in mixing bowl then chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add curry powder and carrots then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then sauté <b>5 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
Add apples and chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add water, stock paste, tomato paste and bay leaves then cook <b>30-40 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Place chickpeas, pepper, salt, curry powder and olive oil in a large bowl then toss to combine. Transfer to baking tray and bake for 20 minutes (200°C) or until chickpeas are crispy.
Carefully remove bay leaves from soup. Add cream and purée <b>1 min/speed 4<b>, <b>increasing speed gradually to speed 9.<b>
Divide soup between bowls, then season with pepper and garnish with crispy chickpeas then serve.

hintsAndTricks: Please refer to The Basic Cookbook for the meat or vegetable stock paste recipes.
